page.title: 02Edinburgh Castle
page.content: The castle is the centre of local history and tourism in Edinburgh. It stands on a dramatic site at the top of Castle Rock, which is a volcanic plug, looking down on Princes Street several hundred feet below. There have been fortifications on this site since ancient, times but the present castle is relatively modern, dating from the 17th century. The castle is the haedquarters of the army in Scotland. On the Esplanade the Edinburgh Tattoo, a military display, is held each year during the Edinburgh Festival. The castle is the top tourist attraction in Scotland. It houses several museums, St. Margarets Chapel (the oldest building in the castle) and Mons Meg(a 15th century cannon). Also the Scotish Royal Regalia are on display.
